code: @Manual{,   title = {maudr: Generation of enzyme kinetics datasets},   author = {Jarek Bryk and Lewis Ward and Richard Bingham},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.4.0},   url = {https://github.com/jarekbryk/maudr}, }

title: maudr
text: maudr R package designed generate, distribute, evaluate enzyme kinetics data teaching assessment undergraduate biochemistry laboratory courses. allows instructors produce individualized, experimental datasets based real enzyme parameters, complete enzyme inhibition conditions, produce corresponding answers visual summaries. package uses yeast alcohol dehydrogenase five alcohol substrates default enzyme, can extended enzyme basic processing parameters known. name package play name Dr Maud Menten, Canadian biochemist established fundamental principles enzyme kinetics, along Dr Leonor Michaelis.

title: maudr
text: typical use scenario package instructors produce individual datasets students contain absorbance values inhibited non-inhibited reaction alcohol dehydrogenase range substrate concentrations different inhibitors. input file reaction parameters can modified accommodate enzymes inhibitors. individual datasets generated package also include small amount user-controllable random variation absorbance values, simulate experimental variation. data can analysed students produce visualisations enzyme reaction rates (absorbance vs time, dependant substrate concentrations), plot Michaelis-Menten curves estimate Km values identify type inhibition using Lineweaver-Burk double-reciprocal plot. individual datasets analysed students require individual solutions calculated ploted instructors, package also produces plots estimated Km Vmax values individual studentsâ€™ datasets comparisons inhibited non-inhibited conditions. Originally, set scripts became maudr package developed COVID-19 lockdowns, students attend laboratory classes still wanted practice topics enzyme kinetics. Since , used functions produce datasets formative exercises students, either preparation laboratory classes, use revision sessions. One us (JB) presented idea package 2024 useR! conference Salzburg; slides (static ) presentation included package available useR! pages.

title: maudr
text: maudr available GitHub, plans upload CRAN.

title: maudr
text: package uses enzyme kinetic parameters S. cerevisiae alcohol dehydrogenase, established 1987 publication Ganzhorn et al.. Excel file parameters ADH inhibitors provided default (reaction_parameters.xlsx), however, parameters enzymes inhibitors can provided user, long column names remain unchanged (Fig. 1.): rxn_substrate Kcat Km Vmax enzyme_conc inhibition_actual default parameters used, input file required package Excel file list students datasets generated analysed. file must one row per student, following column headers (Fig. 2.): student_no â€“ unique student ID (e.g.Â â€œu123456â€) first_name â€“ studentâ€™s first name surname â€“ studentâ€™s surname

title: maudr
text: package four main functions produce studentsâ€™ datasets analysis results; functions used order.

title: maudr
text: Sets top-level folder (default location: current folder) input data stored output produced. top-level folder named â€œmaudr_assignmentsâ€ unless different name specified user. Folders data output created, subfolders output/assignments_output output/answers_output. RStudio project structure used.

title: maudr
text: Takes list students table enzyme parameters creates metadata table assignment every student--reaction conditions, randomly drawn reaction_parameters.xlsx file. table deposited output/assignments_output folder top-level project folder created initialiseProject(). neither input files provided, function runs demo mode, using provided list four imaginary students enzyme parameters ADH proceed. output assignReactions() list timestamp metadata table student-reaction assignments. timestamp used input next function serves unique identifier run package.

title: maudr
text: Takes timestamp input (, invisibly, student-reaction assignments table) produces Excel file student absorbances reactions assigned substrate inhibitor. files deposited output/assignments_output folder given timestamp.

title: maudr
text: Takes timestamp input (, invisibly, student-specific files) produces PDF file results analysis studentsâ€™ data. results include plots : absorbance vs time (inhibited non-inhibited reactions) Michaelis-Menten curves (inhibited non-inhibited reactions) Lineweaver-Burk (inhibited non-inhibited reactions, regression equations) PDF files can generated individually student separate files, together single file, . PDF files deposited output/assignments_output folder given timestamp.

title: maudr
code: library(maudr)  initialiseProject(path = "~/Desktop")  setup <- assignReactions(student_file = "~/Documents/students_file.xlsx", project_path = "~/Desktop/maudr_assignments") # students_file.xlsx is copied into the data folder in the top level folder; the default reaction_parameters.xlsx is used.  generateAssignments(run_timestamp = setup$timestamp, project_path = "~/Desktop/maudr_assignments") # Assignments (one Excel file per student) will be deposited in the output/assignment_output folder  generateAnswers(run_timestamp = setup$timestamp, project_path = "~/Desktop/maudr_assignments", output_files = "both") # Assignments (one PDF file per student plus a single PDf with answers with all students' datasets) will be deposited in the output/answers_output folder

title: maudr
text: Use nls function plot estimate Michaelis-Menten curves inspired 2015 post prof. Paul Brennan describing prof. Rob Bentonâ€™s script use .

title: Summary
text: maudr R package designed generate, distribute, evaluate enzyme kinetics data teaching assessment undergraduate biochemistry laboratory courses. allows instructors produce individualized, experimental datasets based real enzyme parameters, complete enzyme inhibition conditions, produce corresponding answers visual summaries. package uses yeast alcohol dehydrogenase five alcohol substrates default, can extended enzyme basic processing parameters known. name package play name Dr Maud Menten, Canadian biochemist established fundamental principles enzyme kinetics, along Dr Leonor Michaelis.

title: Summary
text: typical use scenario package instructors produce individual datasets contain absorbance values inhibited non-inhibited reaction yeast alcohol dehydrogenase range substrate concentrations different inhibitors. enzyme parameters substrate taken REF. Given list students - required user-supplied input file - package randomly assign substrate inhibitor student generate absorbance values non-inhibited inhibited reactions substrate concentrations 0 160 mM, using enzymeâ€™s Kcat, Km Vmax. individual datasets can also include small amount user-controllable variation absorbance values, simulate experimental variation. maudr generate single Excel file absorbance data student. files can provided students analysis produce visualisations enzyme reaction rates absorbance vs time, dependent substrate concentration, plot Michaelis-Menten curves estimate Km values identify type inhibition using Lineweaver-Burk double-reciprocal plot. individual datasets analysed students require solutions calculated visualised instructors, package also produces plots estimated Km Vmax values individual studentsâ€™ datasets comparisons inhibited non-inhibited conditions. Solutions student generated PDF files (one page per student), option saving separate file student collate individual PDFs single file, .

what: Assign reaction conditions to students â€” assignReactions
title: Assign reaction conditions to students â€” assignReactions
text: Randomly assigns student one substrate one inhibition type (excluding "no_inhibition"), creates paired condition "no_inhibition". student therefore two rows: one inhibited one uninhibited reaction. function writes metadata Excel file timestamped assignments_output folder.

title: Assign reaction conditions to students â€” assignReactions
code: assignReactions(   student_file = NULL,   enzyme_file = NULL,   project_path = ".",   seed = 1234,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Assign reaction conditions to students â€” assignReactions
text: student_file Optional path Excel file containing student list columns student_no, first_name, surname. enzyme_file Optional path Excel file containing enzyme parameters (e.g. reaction_parameters.xlsx). project_path Path top-level project folder created initialiseProject(). Default current working directory. seed Random seed reproducibility (default = 1234). verbose Logical; TRUE (default), prints progress messages.

title: Assign reaction conditions to students â€” assignReactions
text: Invisibly returns list : timestamp Timestamp string identifying output folder. metadata tibble studentâ€“reaction assignments.

title: Assign reaction conditions to students â€” assignReactions
text: input files provided, demo datasets bundled package used automatically.

title: Assign reaction conditions to students â€” assignReactions
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ proj <- initialiseProject() assignReactions(project_path = proj, seed = 4321) } # }

what: Generate answer PDFs from assignment Excel files â€” generateAnswers
title: Generate answer PDFs from assignment Excel files â€” generateAnswers
text: Reads student assignment files, estimates rates (optionally) Km/Vmax, renders per-student answer pages : Absorbance vs time (faceted rxn_condition) Michaelis-Menten (conditions one plot; optional nls fit) Lineweaver-Burke (conditions one plot; fitted lm lines)

title: Generate answer PDFs from assignment Excel files â€” generateAnswers
code: generateAnswers(   run_timestamp,   output_files = c("single", "separate", "both"),   project_path = ".",   verbose = TRUE )

title: Generate answer PDFs from assignment Excel files â€” generateAnswers
text: run_timestamp Timestamp string (YYYY-MM-DD_HHMM) assignReactions(). output_files One "separate", "single", "". Default "single". project_path Path top-level project folder (default "."). verbose Logical; show progress messages (default TRUE).

title: Generate answer PDFs from assignment Excel files â€” generateAnswers
text: Invisibly TRUE.

what: Generate assignment Excel files for each student â€” generateAssignments
title: Generate assignment Excel files for each student â€” generateAssignments
text: Reads setup metadata (assignReactions()) produces per-student Excel files simulated absorbance vs. time data. student receives inhibited uninhibited conditions one sheet. true inhibition type remains instructor metadata.

title: Generate assignment Excel files for each student â€” generateAssignments
code: generateAssignments(   run_timestamp,   project_path = ".",   verbose = TRUE,   cuv_vol = 0.003,   eps = 6220,   enz_vol = 0.1,   substr_conc = c(0, 10, 20, 40, 80, 160),   time_vec = c(0.17, 0.33, 0.5, 0.66, 0.83, 1),   use_jitter = TRUE,   jitter_sd = 0.02 )

title: Generate assignment Excel files for each student â€” generateAssignments
text: run_timestamp Timestamp string (YYYY-MM-DD_HHMM) assignReactions(). project_path Path top-level project folder (default "."). verbose Logical; show progress messages (default TRUE). cuv_vol Cuvette volume litres (default 0.003). eps Extinction coefficient (default 6220). enz_vol Enzyme volume millilitres (default 0.1). substr_conc Vector substrate concentrations mM. time_vec Vector reaction time points minutes. use_jitter Logical; add random noise absorbances (default TRUE). jitter_sd Numeric; SD additive noise use_jitter = TRUE (default 0.02, .e. Â±2% variability).

title: Generate assignment Excel files for each student â€” generateAssignments
text: Invisibly returns TRUE writing student assignment files updating metadata.

title: Generate assignment Excel files for each student â€” generateAssignments
text: Random measurement noise ("jitter") optionally applied per student reproducible way based run seed student ID.

what: Initialise a maudr project folder structure â€” initialiseProject
title: Initialise a maudr project folder structure â€” initialiseProject
text: Creates self-contained top-level project folder (default: "maudr_assignments") containing subfolders data/, code/, output/ (assignments_output/ answers_output/ inside). Works RStudio Positron; .Rproj file created.

title: Initialise a maudr project folder structure â€” initialiseProject
Initialise a maudr project folder structure â€” initialiseProject
text: path Base directory create project folder (default "."). name Name top-level project folder (default "maudr_assignments"). verbose Logical; show progress messages (default TRUE).

title: Initialise a maudr project folder structure â€” initialiseProject
text: full path newly created project folder (invisibly).

title: Initialise a maudr project folder structure â€” initialiseProject
